main event: A woman in Jackson, Mississippi reported sighting two 'flying saucers' in February 1960, moving in a westerly direction at an estimated 1000 to 1500 feet altitude for approximately four minutes.
interesting points: The objects were round, metallic in appearance, and left a vapor trail similar to that of jet aircraft.
Another witness in the vicinity confirmed seeing similar objects previously while working on a cotton plantation in the area.
A meteorologist from the U.S. Weather Bureau confirmed that the objects could not have been weather balloons.
The witness, Mrs. R, was described as sincere and her recollection of the incident was detailed.
The report highlighted that the objects emitted a steady light, but the sound was not similar to that of a jet aircraft.
sighted object: two metallic flying saucers with vapor trails
witnesses: Mrs. R, another witness in the vicinity, and Mr. George Fisk (meteorologist, U.S. Weather Bureau)
photographs: no the report does not include photographs
